page.title: 02"Gooseham" Morwenstow
page.content:
My home is in the countryside I have a lovely view I see the trees rise far and wide The soft green meadows too.
For Gooseham in an hollow lies With farmsteads dotted round I hear the owls when daylight dies And oft the fog-horn sound
For just across from yonder hill The wild Atlantic rolls I hear the waves when nights are still I see the herring gulls
I watch the lazy cows go by I hear the bleat of sheep The birds' sweet song as in bed I lie When day begins to peep{ { { Mrs Elizabeth Oke, July 1954 { }
